segment.tokens: At length the boy was attacked with the small-pox
during the early stages of his disorder the cat rarely left his bed-side
as his danger increased
it was thought necessary to remove the cat
lock her up
The child died
having escaped from her confinement
On the following day the cat immediately ran to the apartment where she hoped to find her playmate
where she hoped to find her playmate
Disappointed in her expectations
she sought for him with symptoms of great uneasiness and loud lamentations all over the house
till she came to the door of the room in which the corpse lay
of the room in which the corpse lay
Here she lay down in silent grief
till she was again locked up
as the child was buried
the cat set at liberty
As soon she disappeared
it was not till a fortnight after that event
that she returned to the well-known apartment sad emaciated
She refused to take any nourishment soon
ran away again with dismal cries
compelled hunger
At length , compelled by hunger she made her appearance one day at dinner-time
she continued to visit the house after that , every day , at about the same hour
she always left as soon
as she had eaten the food
the food was given her
No one knew
where she spent the rest of her time , until she was found , one day under the wall of the burying-ground to the grave of her favorite
she was found
so strong was the of the cat to her lost friend
lost
removed to another place , nearly five years afterward she never

that till his parents removed to another place , nearly five years afterward , she never except in the severest winter weather passed the night any where else than in the burying-ground at her little friend 's grave
Here is another of a cat who exhibited in a similar way her love for her deceased master
a cat exhibited in a similar way her love for her deceased master
her love for her deceased master
it is believed
this story are strictly
The incidents of this story , which , it is believed , are strictly true , occurred in the north of Scotland
residing in that country , whose habits of life had always been of the most retired description , giving way to the natural despondency of his disposition ,
that country habits of life had always been of the most retired description , giving way to the natural despondency of his disposition ,
most retired
giving way to the natural despondency of his disposition
Some years ago a poor man put an end to his existence
The only other inmate of his cottage was a favorite
When the deed was discovered
the cat was found assiduously
watching over her late master 's body
it was with some difficulty she could be driven away
she could be driven away
The appalling deed naturally excited a great deal of attention in the surrounding neighborhood
the body was deposited in the grave , which was made at the outside of the church-yard
the grave was made at the outside of the church-yard
on the day after the body was deposited in the grave , which was made at the outside of the church-yard a number of school-boys ventured thither to view the resting-place of one
who had at times been the of village wonder
whose recent act of self-destruction was invested with additional interest
At first no one was enough to venture near
at last the appearance of a hole in the side of the grave irresistibly attracted their attention
Having been minutely examined
it was at length determined
that it must have been the of some body-snatcher
the story having spread
the grave was minutely examined
as the body had not been removed
the community considered themselves fortunate
having made so narrow an escape
The turf was replaced
the grave again carefully covered up
On the following morning the turf was again displaced
a hole deeper than before yawned in the side of the sad receptacle
Speculation was soon at work
all sorts of explanations were suggested
alarmed perhaps the noise of the disputants

In the midst of their speculations , alarmed , perhaps , by the noise of the disputants poor Puss darted from the hole much to the confusion of some of the most noisy and dogmatic expounders of the mystery
Again the turf was replaced
again again was
removed the unceasing efforts of the faithful cat to share the resting-place of her deceased master
It was at last found necessary to shoot her
it being found impossible otherwise to put a stop to her unceasing importunities
The enmity of the cat and dog is
Yet instances have been known
which the closest friendship has been formed between them
A French author of a work on the Language of Brutes tells the following story "
I had a cat dog
a cat dog became so attached to each other
that they would never willingly be
Whenever the dog got any choice morsel of food
he was to divide it with his whiskered friend
They always ate sociably of one plate
They slept in the same bed
They daily walked out together
Wishing to put this apparently sincere friendship to the proof
I one day took the cat by herself into my room
while I had the dog
guarded in another apartment
I entertained the cat in a most sumptuous manner
she would make without her friend , who had hitherto been her constant table companion
her friend had hitherto been her constant table
The cat enjoyed the treat with great glee
The cat seemed to have entirely forgotten the dog
I had had a partridge for dinner
a partridge for dinner half I intended to keep for supper
My wife covered it with a plate
My wife put it into a cupboard , the door of which she did not lock
into a cupboard , the door of which she did not lock
The cat left the room
I walked out upon business
My wife meanwhile sat at work in an adjoining apartment
When I returned home
she related to me the following circumstances mewed uncommonly loud
having hastily left the dining-room
The cat went to the dog mewed uncommonly loud in different tones of voice
which the dog from time to time answered with a short bark
They both then went to the door of the room where the cat had dined
where the cat had dined
They both waited
till it was opened
One of my children opened the door
immediately the two friends entered the apartment
The mewing of the cat excited my wife attention
She rose from her seat
She stepped softly
up to the door , which stood ajar , to observe what was going on
the door stood ajar to observe
what was going on

The cat led the dog to the cupboard which contained the partridge , pushed off the plate which covered it , and , taking out my intended supper , laid it before her canine friend , who devoured it greedily
the cupboard contained

Probably the cat by her mewing had given the dog to understand what an excellent meal "
she had made
how sorry she was

at the same time had explained to him

persuaded him to follow her thither
